intro: Strychnos javariensis, commonly known as the Java strychnos, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds covered in a fleshy, red aril. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its toxic properties, it is typically avoided by livestock and humans.
